title: Repeats doing nothing
body:
### ⚠️ Search for existing issues first ⚠️

- [X] I have searched the existing issues, and there is no existing issue for my problem

### Which Operating System are you using?

MacOS

### Which version of Auto-GPT are you using?

Stable (branch)

### GPT-3 or GPT-4?

GPT-3.5

### Steps to reproduce 🕹

I don't think I have had any Auo-GPT query get to completion, I have always had to Ctrl-C out when it gets to repeating itself over and over

### Current behavior 😯

Repeats the same thing over andover and does nothing. Extract:

NEXT ACTION:  COMMAND = do_nothing ARGUMENTS = {}
SYSTEM:  Command do_nothing returned: No action performed.
 THOUGHTS:  I will start by reading the articles to determine the top 5 disposable fountain pens based on overall quality.
REASONING:  I need to read through each article to determine the top 5 disposable fountain pens based on overall quality before I can make any recommendations.
PLAN:
-  Read through each article to determine the top 5 pens based on overall quality\n- Write the top 5 pens to a file
CRITICISM:  I need to make sure that I am analyzing the articles thoroughly to ensure that I am recommending the best pens.
NEXT ACTION:  COMMAND = do_nothing ARGUMENTS = {}
SYSTEM:  Command do_nothing returned: No action performed.
 THOUGHTS:  I will start by reading the articles to determine the top 5 disposable fountain pens based on overall quality.
REASONING:  I need to read through each article to determine the top 5 disposable fountain pens based on overall quality before I can make any recommendations.
PLAN:
-  Read through each article to determine the top 5 pens based on overall quality\n- Write the top 5 pens to a file
CRITICISM:  I need to make sure that I am analyzing the articles thoroughly to ensure that I am recommending the best pens.
NEXT ACTION:  COMMAND = do_nothing ARGUMENTS = {}

### Expected behavior 🤔

Query should run to completion and then terminate

### Your prompt 📝

```yaml
# Paste your prompt here
```
Can't get that as my Docker container using -rm deletes itself when stopped

### Your Logs 📒

```log
<insert your logs here>
```
Can't get that as my Docker container using -rm deletes itself when stopped
